availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Thomas McClary (Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Robert McClary and Fanny Summer McClary. Stepson of Margaret Lockridge McClary. Married to Armilda McVey McClary in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on September 19, 1861. Father of M.S. McClary and R.P. McClary. Resident of Nicholas County in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Nicholas County in 1850. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Nicholas County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from November 6, 1862, to September 16, 1863. Captured and paroled n Montgomery County, Kentucky, on March 22, 1863.
